de.lambeck.pned.models.gui

Class DrawPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • de.lambeck.pned.models.gui.DrawPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInfo_DrawingAreaSize, IInfo_MousePos, IInfo_SelectionRangeSize, IInfo_Status, IDrawPanel, IModelRename, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class DrawPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements IDrawPanel, IModelRename, IInfo_MousePos, IInfo_SelectionRangeSize, IInfo_DrawingAreaSize, IInfo_Status
    The draw panel for one Petri net. Holds a reference to the status bar so that the draw panel can show status messages etc.

    Actions for mouse events: See MyMouseAdapter
    Author:
    Thomas Lambeck, 4128320
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,javax.swing.AbstractAction> popupActions)
        Constructs the DrawPanel.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        displayName - The name of the tab (the file name only)
        appController - The application controller
        guiController - The GUI model controller
        popupActions - List of Actions

      • getCurrentGuiModel

        private IGuiModel getCurrentGuiModel()
        Returns the current IGuiModel from the IGuiModelController.

        Note: This model may be a different object reference if the user has invoked an Undo or Redo operation! This means: no change in the model but replacing the model with another model.
        Returns:
        the current IGuiModel

      • resetState

        public void resetState()
        Description copied from interface: IDrawPanel
        Resets the state of this DrawPanel (e.g. Cursor, old mouse operations interrupted by tab switching etc.)

        Note: Otherwise, a draw panel with the "moveCursor" could be left via tab switch using the mouse. And when the user re-enters this tab, there would still be the moveCursor active even without pressing ALT on the keyboard!
        Specified by:
        resetState in interface IDrawPanel

      • resetMouseOperations

        private void resetMouseOperations()
        Resets old mouse operations.

        Note: Intended to be used for putting an element to the background.
        Specified by:
